ingredients: 1 Tbsp Olive Oil
1 Medium Red Onion, Diced
4 cloves garlic, Minced
2 small red peppers
3 cups (or 2 10-oz bags frozen) ½ Inch Diced, Peeled Butternut Squash
1 tsp cumin
1 tsp Chili Powder
a pinch each salt & pepper (** more to taste)
a pinch each salt & pepper (** more to taste)
3 cups black beans, cooked (** or 2 15-oz cans black beans, rinsed & drained)
6 Yellow Corn Tortillas (taco Size), Cut Into Thick Strips
1½ cups homemade enchilada sauce (** see recipe below) OR 1 can (15-oz) red enchilada sauce
1 cup Manchego cheese, divided (** Colby Jack or a Mexican blend)
** Optional for serving: Cilantro, guacamole, & hot sauce. We topped ours with greek yogurt .. though a low-fat sour cream .. or even labnah would be some other alternatives

** Optional for serving: Cilantro, guacamole, & hot sauce. We topped ours with greek yogurt .. though a low-fat sour cream .. or even labnah would be some other alternatives
3 Tbsp olive oil
1½ Tbsp whole wheat flour
¼ cup chili powder
2 cups chicken stock (** I used Magic Mineral Broth)
10 oz tomato paste
1 tsp dried oregano
1 tsp ground cumin
½ tsp kosher salt
